Prerequisites: ADMISSION TO ACCOUNTING MINOR, FOR NON-ACCOUNTING BUSINESS MAJORS ONLY.
Course Description: THIS COURSE FOCUSES ON FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING FOR NON-ACCOUNTING BUSINESS MAJORS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO:
1. UNDERSTAND KEY ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES THAT UNDERLIE A CORPORATE ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
2. APPRAISE COMMUNICATION OF FINANCIAL AND NON-FINANCIAL INFORMATION UNDER VOLUNTARY AND
MANDATORY DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS.
3. DIFFERENTIATE PRINCIPLES-BASED AND RULE S-BASED STANDARDS.
4. ANALYZE DISCLOSURES IN THE INCOME STATEMENT, BALANCE SHEET, STATEMENT OF OWNERS' EQUITY, AND
STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS
5. ACCOUNT FOR BASIC TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING CASH, RECEIVABLES, INVENTORIES, INVESTMENTS, PLANT
ASSETS, INTANGIBLE ASSETS, CURRENT AND LONG TERM LIABILITIES, AND STOCKHOLDERS' EQUITY
6. ASSESS FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS IN AN INTERNATIONAL FRAMEWORK.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
